1st, there is a way to check and see which scenario numbers a team has 
been through.  I requested such a program and its location is 
http://sluggy.net/glad/ .  I suggest you try it for yourself.

My biggest problem with using only the built-in scenarios is 'Lake 
Tracona'.  Who needs to bother cheating to gain more money, when you 
can spend hours at 'Lake Tracona' building up experience for your 
cleric(s).  That is the biggest reason I want checkpoints for a 
tournament.  Every 2-3 weeks, when assumedly you have completed five 
scenarios or so, you send your saved file in.  The judges you use the 
above program to verify you are not going through extra scenarios and 
extract basic stats about your team to post to the group.  If anybody 
thinks a person is cheating by looking at the stats, that person can 
challenge.  All judges will work through it those scenarios up to that 
point to check.  If there are no prizes, why would someone bother 
cheating to gain lots of extra money?
